alert.note: Alert for Petroleum (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 23 at 2:12PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Montana, including the following county, Petroleum. * WHEN...Through late Saturday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - An organized and efficient low pressure system from the central Rocky Mountains will emerge over the high plains of eastern Montana this afternoon and slowly move through this region through Saturday night. Multiple thunderstorms moving over the same areas will easily cause area creeks and streams to rise. Ponding and low-land flooding will be possible through this weekend. Greater rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are more likely near and south of MT-Highway 200. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
